page.title: 10CHALFONT AREA LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: QUAKER VILLAGE - JORDANS Purpose built in 1918 on 102 acres acquired by The Society of Friends to promote ideals and principles and encourage village industries. 30 cottages and 21 flats owned by Jordans Village Ltd are rented to families of original tenants. 4 flats retained for elderly. 91 residences now freehold but subject to Management Committee restrictions to maintain character. Within the admininistrative area are a village green, hall, Post Office Stores, Primary School, tennis court, bowling green and 6 acres of beechwood preserved as an open space with a 60 year re-seeding scheme for oaks and beeches begun in 1970. Also The Ark, a rehabilitation home for Epilepsy sufferers. Few village crafts remain and there is no through road, church or public house.
